intro: Acourtia lobulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Acourtia lobulata is often found in California and is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
